title: Do you use your personal iOS device for development? - Quora

response.answer_text: I do use my personal iOS device for development and you should too, here's why… If you are building an app, taking it out into the real world is crucial. Your apps gets to deal with all kind of scenarios that are very easy to overlook when you're developing on a simulator in your cozy office. Possible scenarios that I always forget to test in my cozy office is slow data connections and receiving phone calls while I'm using the app. There's usually more things I find when I'm testing the app on my phone outside in real world.

Yes. Why wouldn’t I? iOS sandboxes apps from each other and from the operating system. It’d be very difficult to mess something up with a app I’m building. And even if I manage to somehow do so, rebooting the device would very likely fix any problem. So I’m not risking anything to do this.
